reviews.text: I came back last Saturday from the Barcelo, Punta Cana. I have to say that unfortunately, the weather was not the best. But we still managed to have some fun. The beach is spectacular and the water is beautiful. Don't forget to do some snorkling...not expensive and worth it! you get to go on a boat ride and see all the ocean view resorts !.
reviews.title: Barcelo...ok

likes.liked: — The beach and ocean view room

reviews.text: Going back, I would probably pay more in a 5 star hotel. The staff were somewhat rude and the food.....so so. I was sick for a few days but I think it's because of the Malaria pills. Beware of the side effects!
reviews.title: A Great Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I would give this resort a 3.5/5.
reviews.title: sun, sand and smiles
Had a great time at the Barcelo Punta Cana
reviews.text: My family and I returned from a one week stay at this resort on April 12. We had an excellent vacation. With all the negative reviews, I was kind of worried, but I have to say there was no need for worry. This was the first trip to the Dominican for my two daughters, aged 13 and 15. It was our second trip. Last year we went to Puerta Plata.

The rooms were kept clean. Nothing fancy about them but they were adequate for the amount of time we spent in them. Plenty of hot water and no power outages. The beach was amazing, had plenty of chairs but hard to find one with shade unless you got out there early enough. The pool was kept clean and the water was a really nice temperature. There were plenty of poolside activities and games. The grounds were very well kept. The food was fine, never went hungry. No swarms of insects around the food like stated in one of the reviews. The drinks were good although service was sometimes slow but not complaining. The entertainment in the evening was enjoyable to watch.
reviews.title: holiday from hell
They should shut this place down
reviews.text: Stayed from Aug 22-31st...the island is absolutely gorgeous...the view from my hotel room, amazing! THE HOTEL IS HORRIBLE, the service is awful...its basically a weekend getaway for locals and that is who they cater to. My room had a serious leak in the bathroom that they refused to fix, they wouldn't give us towels or toilet paper, we complained EVERY SINGLE DAY. Our AC didn't work, the room smelled like mildew, the pillows smelled like crap, I got tired of killing bugs in my room, there was a huge bug in my food @ one of the restaurants...I got sick from the food because it was so disgusting...the night life sucked, the male employees are pigs. You can't even get next to the swim up bar because of the crowd of locals around it. The food service at the buffet was awful...I ordered room service one night because I didn't feel well enough to leave my room...it never came!!!! We were supposed to stay @ a different resort but our travel agent screwed up big time and sent us to this dump claiming it is such an "UPSCALE" property. I can say that I probably lost at least 15 pounds from all the walking, the fact that I didn't eat for days, and the time spent in the bathroom. Definitely the place to be if you're looking to lose a few pounds, lol!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this was our 25 anniversary present to ourselfs.It was our first trip ever.The flying was bad ,but the barcelo was paradice,the people that worked there were so friendly and nice.the other guests were also nice even so the odd few werent, like any where else i suppose .There was nothing that we did not like about this place.may be one ,the dominican restaruant was not so good,The best beach ever we loved the waves.would go again in an intsant.
reviews.title: paradice,paradice,paradice

reviews.text: A group of us went down for Labor day weekend for a friend's wedding...at first glance...and on the website- the hotel and grounds look nice. The reality...absolutely no service. what went wrong...
reviews.title: Horrible Service...Gross Hotel!!!

likes.disliked: — it was extremely dirty- no service at ALL!

reviews.text: The AC didn't work.
reviews.title: fantastic holiday!! ignore the bad reviews!!!!

likes.liked: — fantastic location with beautiful grounds and beach
likes.disliked: — the hotel is in the process of being updated so some areas are a little tired

reviews.text: The power went out twice (as did the water while in the shower).
reviews.title: This place is great

likes.liked: — Location,beautiful beach right on your doorstep

reviews.text: Our vacation was from July 29th through Aug. 5th of 2008. The vacation started out great. We got to the hotel about 6pm, and it took about 20 minutes to check in. We did in fact get a renovated room in building 3. We had our travel agent send an email one week before going there requesting a renovated room with a king size bed. We did not get a welcome drink, but hey, who cares, right?
reviews.title: Great Vacation but the food is bad!!!

likes.disliked: — The food made us all sick.

reviews.text: Room:
reviews.title: Loved Barcelo Premium

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is nicely renovated with a king size bed, flat panel TV (mostly all the channels are in spanish), the bathroom is nice. There also was a safe in the room and a mini fridge with three waters, a Coke, a Sprite, and a Coke Light, and 2 beers.
reviews.title: Good for money but nothing to go back to, Management needs a rehaul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pools:
reviews.title: Good time with fair accomodations

likes.liked: — ocean view, beach, and meeting new people
likes.disliked: — long lines, and inconsistency of food, drinks, and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both of the pools are great and very clean. One pool is more for partying and the other is more of the "quiet" pool. Only the party pool has the swim up pool bar. The water is perfect temperature.
reviews.title: BARCELO NEVER AGAIN

likes.liked: — The beach of this Hotel is beautiful every thing else is terribel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week in may with my husband. good points;
reviews.title: great value, lovely room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room (in block 3) was lovely-we had a fruit platter and a bottle of rum as a gift for our anniversary. food was generally good. mexican, seafood, japanese and italian restaurants the best. we took our own beach towels but didnt need them. sports bar great.
reviews.title: Ignore All The Whining......

reviews.text: beautiful beach. nice wreck just off the beach if youre into diving. horseriding ok but expensive ($40).
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.text: bad points; food in the main restaurant average, paris restaurant crap. some of the cocktails are very weak! bar staff can be a bit surly. night club awful-smells of sick! casino not great.
reviews.title: loved pools beach, hated buffet food

reviews.text: All in all we paid £518 for a weeks all-inclusive, which I think was great value, we both had slightly bad tummies, but I think that ia par for the course when travelling to these destinations. weather in may is not the best-bit stormy.
reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed!

likes.liked: — The fact that I had to ask for towels and washcloths daily!

reviews.text: We spent nine days at the Breezes Punta Cana, 12/23/2005-1231/2005. This is a great family resort that will keep you and the family entertained even if you never leave the property.
reviews.title: Christams in the DR

likes.liked: — The pool is huge, on of the largest I have ever seen.
likes.disliked: — Not much, this place is great.

reviews.text: The rooms are not very fancy but are tastefully decorated and have plenty of room to enjoy your free time. The resort has some great kids programs, a trapeze and a learning station on a trampoline.
reviews.title: we liked this place

likes.liked: — we didnt go hungry or thirsty

reviews.text: Unfortunately the islands roads have alot to be desired, this was one of the few islands we have visited that we did not rent a car to go exploring. In the closest town of Bavaro there is some nice shopping for local souveneirs and cigars or alcohol, not much in the way of jewelry or nicer items. We even took a car 45 minutes to the largest city in the area: Higuey (e-way) to see if we could find some gold jewelry or watches, to na avail. There ia a beautiful Catholic church there but not much else.
reviews.title: Banana Mamas+Pina Colitas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are plenty of great tours available, we took an all day ATV tour that was the highlight of our trip, we stopped at a cave for some swimming and photos, through a few small local towns and eneded up on a beautiful beach. What a day, we were fortunate that the other groups that booked this tour did not show up, so it was my wife and 12 year old son only. the young local guys who gave us the tour were great and really made my son feel special.
reviews.title: November 30 2006 - Great beach, excellent rum!

reviews.text: The DR was great for us to have a stress free Christmas, we will be going back, probably to Puerto Plata next time.
reviews.title: Remind yourself you are on vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this resort 11/09/07 for one week and wished we had stayed for two. Sure, there are renovations going on but nothing to stop you from enjoying your stay. Our room was kept clean and well stocked with beverages. We had a pool/ocean view room on the top florr in building 6 and could not have asked for a better location. The restaurants are very good although the one featuring local food wasn't the best for us. We did enjoy very much the Japanese and the seafood restaurants. I was able to get in one round of golf at the Punta Blanca GC designed by Nick Price. Although pricey ($165 green fee/$40 club rental) it was well worth the money. We read a lot of reviews before we selected this hotel and decided that you can't always go by the bad reviews. These people you can never satisfy. I have attached a few photos.
reviews.title: A wonderful resort

likes.liked: — The fantastic pool and the beautiful white sandy beach.

reviews.text: Rick Phillips
reviews.title: Not A Good Idea to Stay HERE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kitchener, Ontario
reviews.title: Great Place - Just stay AWAY from the casino!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is highly over rated and I would not recommend staying here. I met a couple last week on an aircraft considering staying here and they begged me to go on this site and write about my experiences. The following are issues we had with the resort:
reviews.title: Get your money worth!
Great Staff
reviews.text: * "check in" was disorganised, we wait 1 hour to get our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ABOUT PRESTIGE CLASS:
reviews.title: Here is the real deal

likes.liked: — The beach nd the pools were great!

reviews.text: • our room was not recently renovated (as the transat website indicates), only the CLUB PREMIUM and some rooms in the middle of the hotel were.
reviews.title: Had an excellent time!!!!!!!

reviews.text: • you get only 4 à la carte reservations (not 5), and they are pre-arranged so if you don't like the ones they choose you have to make new reservations at the hotel desk
reviews.title: Overall Very Good

reviews.text: • no fruit platter on arrival (although I wouldn't recommend eating fruit there)
reviews.title: Great Beach, Amazing Food.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: • no beach towels, robes or slippers in these rooms
reviews.title: Did not catch the...4-th Star!

reviews.text: We stayed in Barcelo Punta Cana from Oct 2nd through Oct 7. We went through CheapCaribbean when they had some special on this particular hotel. So opting to try something different than Cancun, we decided to try our luck going to the DR and staying at another Barcelo hotel. We stayed at one previously in Mayan Riviera. Here is a run through of our experience.
reviews.title: Good Deal, Average Stay, Good Time Nonetheless

reviews.text: Check In - Check in was a breeze. We were at the front desk for no longer than 5 minutes or so. An attendent named Mariano took our luggage and gave us quick tour of the hotel as we walked through the hotel. Really nice guy if you meet and talk to him. And in case you haven't seen in other reviews, Yes, it is to your advantage to know some spanish in order to possibly get better service and communicate any issues or requests. But most do know english.
reviews.title: What A Dump!!!!!!!!!!!!

likes.liked: — That we didn't stay too long. I wanted to leave the first night!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
likes.disliked: — Read the review. Who do you have to sleep with to get wash cloths!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - We stayed in block 7 with an ocean view room w/ a king bed. Room was ok. Nothing special. The usual stuff including safe. But most importantly it had A/C !!! And it worked wonderfully. I didn't notice any really bad odors do to humidity, but I did take and air freshner anyways just in case. We left about $3 dollars everyday with some dollar store school supply kits (pens,pencil, color variety) for room service and usually had our room cleaned by noon. Always had clean towels and fridge always stocked. Tipping did help there alot.
reviews.title: Nice Place for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food- Breakfast and Lunch buffets were ok I guess. Not that great. I'm not a big buffet fan anyways but managed to find one or two things that would hold me up until dinner. I usually only ate things that they made at the grill in front of you, such as the omelets, pasta and kabobs. Wouldn't eat the burgers, and think my friend got sick off one for a day. Best part I think is the dinners a la carte which weren't to bad at all. I like Tokio and Marlin the best. I found that Tokio wasn't that hot compared to what other reviews had said. I had the lobster at the Marlin which was good. And if you do go there try and get Rudi as your waiter. He was excellent. Actually serive at the Marlin was the best. Of course we tipped a couple bucks after our meal. Roma was...hmmmm...normal just a little better than the buffet food. I had the tenderloin which was a little stringy and kinda dry, but it was alright.
reviews.title: Stay away from this place.

likes.disliked: — The constant noise and loud music!

reviews.text: Bars- Drinks at the bar were ok. Bottom shelf liqour so what do you expect. After a couple of Bahama Mama and Piñas, which were good, I had to switch to the beer (Presidente) which was good. And after a couple mugs of that....its taste really good! If you really want to have a good time, head to the bar in the lobby by Alcazar and make sure Leonardo is your bartender. He'll load you up on some mamajuana and other alcohol that you choose. Funny dude too. Good times! One issue I did find to be weird in the lobby was that this one guy who was walking around looked really shady and was not a guest. He looked like he walked out of a crack house somewhere. Also I saw him with two caucasian teenagers who were guests at a table in the lobby, discussing something quielty that made me think it was a drug deal. My other buddy saw the same thing. And he always had two girls with him, which made me think to things A) He was a drug dealer B) He was a pimp or C) All of the above. I think I'll go with C. He was there every night (again not a guest) he had some hightops and past the knew shorts. My wife also saw him walking next to one of his girls and made a hand motion that made the girl put her hands up as to protective herself from a blow. He didnt hit her,but her reaction made us wonder. He never really approaches anyone or seems to cause trouble, but just makes things feel shady when he was around. Management needs to kick him out.
reviews.title: Fantastic Holiday
punta cana barcelo premium
reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from 5 days in paradise!!!! we stayed from sept 14-19.

First I think some of the people who have written poor ratings may be the "Hard to please" type and nothing is ever good enough. that said.. the place is like paradise. The staff were very attentive. My friend and I were at first given a room with a single bed and since we are 2 straight women this was not acceptable. It took a mere 5 minutes to be in our new room, which was in building 2 . the room was clean, the mini fridge well stocked and refilled as needed....all free. The 2 very large pools were very clean, and my only complaint was that they close at 7 pm and it stayed hot way into the night... a dip in the pool at 9 or 10 would have been delicious.
reviews.title: Bacon Hair and Food Poisoning

likes.disliked: — The bacon had hair on it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok nothing extremely special.. Be careful if you go to the dominican restaurant, when they say pork it means pigs feet!!! but everything was edible.. One other complaint was it was a bit slow to get coffee in the morning.
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday!!

reviews.text: the grounds are clean and well kept. We had fun at the shows and the dancers made it a point to hang around after the show to take pictures if you want. I would return to this resort. I have stayed at another resort in punta cana and this one was 100xs better...
reviews.title: The least hospitable, prostitute driven destination.

reviews.text: so if you have a reservation and are worried about any of the reviews you have read this is my advice.. go with a plan to relax and enjoy the sun, beach and excellent service.
reviews.title: NOT a 4* hotel - barely a 2*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading several reviews my husband and I went with very low expectations. We are both in our late 20's and booked our vacation for under $2000/couple from Vancouver. All-in-all for a 7 hour journey to the East Coast it was a very good deal.
reviews.title: Great Vacation for the money!

likes.liked: — The beach! The best by far!

reviews.text: The hotel - The hotel is older and is under going renovations. If possible try to get into buildings 5, 6, or 7. Our room was in building 7 and faced the hotel besdie us. The room was always clean and we never saw any bugs. The facets and furniture are old but everything was functional. (When we arrived our alarm clock didn't work...we lefta note on it and it was replaced the next day.)
reviews.title: awesome vacation

reviews.text: The food - I have been to 3 all-inclusives prior to this one and the food is average to above average. And once again considering the price we were very impressed. We did get bored of the food but that is to be expected at any all-inclusive.
reviews.title: Amazing Family Vacation, It was Paradise!!!

likes.liked: — The Variety of Restaurants on the Resort

reviews.text: The service - The maids did a very good job in our room. The floors were mopped everyday and we never had any complaints. The bar service can be difficult depending on who is working but it was better than some of the other resorts I have been to in Mexico. I found one bartended at "Sandy's Coffee Bar" named Corpus, he speaks very little english but he was alway extrememly helpful and very pleasant. As for the rest of the hotel staff we found them friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great trip just loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The medical center - We popped into see the doctor one night to ask a few questions. He was extrememly helpful and the medical office was very clean and new. It was nicer than some of the clinics I have been to here at home.
reviews.title: Awesome holiday

reviews.text: We stayed at the Barcelo Punta Cana (Premier) from July 12th - 20th. It was me, my husband, son age 12, daughter age 8, my sister and her husband and daughter age 14, son age 13. We had no trouble with check-in, though we arrived at 1PM and didn't get our room until approx. 3:15PM. But they gave us our bands, we ate lunch and the kids changed into their bathing suits and we got to enjoy the time while waiting.
reviews.title: Beautiful, Great Time, but hospitality is awful
Not as bad as some were making out
reviews.text: Rooms: We were in room 5210. The rooms are small but Very clean though upgrades to bathroom tiles are needed. They are musty smelling and everything gets damp from the high humidity. The air worked JUST fine as we needed to turn it down as we were FREEZIN! My sister was in 3425 - her room was smaller but same upgrades needed and when it rained they had a leak in their bathroom ceiling. One day they had a small lake in there but thankfully it was there last day & nothing got ruined. The towel situation was horrible. Our rooms were cleaned around the same time everyday noonish or so...however 1 day we had to request towels got them about 1 hr later and the 1 day we had to request towels 2x by phone and 2x by a visit to the front desk by my husband. We finally got them 2 1/2 hrs after our first request. My sister went thru the same thing the day before and speaking w/ a guest 2 doors down, they'd been using their pool towels because they've been requesting for 2 days....so that leads to why they were running short of pool towels.

Beach/Pool: Absolutely the BEST Beach! I've been to MANY beaches, Cancun, Cabo San Lucas, Riveria Maya, Jamaica, Bermuda, Puerto Rico, California, VA Beach and NJ Shore...Punta Cana beaches by far is the BEST beach I've ever seen...oh and by the way I NEVER go in the ocean - I spent hours in this ocean. Like a pool w/ a soft sand bottom. The pool was excellent as well. I am amazed it was cool & refreshing EVERY day. The tiles are hot and slippery - so be careful. The entertainment was funny and meet Juan, he's the best!!
reviews.title: worst vacation - Barcelo Punta Cana

reviews.text: Restaurants: You MUST be a food snob if you can't find something you like to eat. We LOVED every meal. Breakfast there was plenty of everything and loved their pastries! Lunch at the grill was also great. We ate at Paris (this was our least favorite as it was HOT and guys had to wear long pants) If its not air conditioned (this was open air) shorts should be allowed as it made it extremely uncomfortable. But we enjoyed our dinners. Tokyo was so much fun and the food was AWESOME. We all loved the Fried Ice Cream, too. Roma was also good. I had Lasagna in DR - and it was great! Great breads & Tiramisu. El Marlin was nice, we like to eat outside and we had 1/2 lobster YUMMY! Kids had ribs and they melted in your mouth. The dinner buffet was GREAT as well. Try the Pasta Station - we eat their 4 nites and got pasta 3x and it was the best. Again you must REALLY be a food SNOB if you can't find somthing to eat. Oh- and as other said about the flies...none laying on the food....yes there is flies around, but not bad AT ALL. My niece did get the big "D" 1 nite and so did I, but u can't go by me as I have IBS and that can flare up just being out of sorts...other than that we were fine.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation

likes.liked: — The beach, service, food. The relaxed atmosphere

reviews.text: A quick note the Dominican people are Not very friendly. These people really need to work on their hospitality and it should be brought to the attention of the resort management companies. Bartenders in the lobby were out and out rude to most americans and caucasian people. Sad to say but true. This would be the only reason I would not return to this resort or country for my next vacation.
reviews.title: Brilliant, if you are a snob go somewhere else!!

reviews.text: The only problem with the Barcelo resort is the food. It's really not good! The beach is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are not fancy but clean and fine. People working there were very friendly. Most of the other guests seemed to be from Central and South America and parts of the US where people are native Spanish speakers. The shows at night were in Spanish - interesting and not a problem. The resort area is very nice. We took a group of graduating High School seniors and they had a blast. The casino and disco were hot spots. The resort is made up of several hotels in an enclosed very large compound - and we didn't feel a need to venture out. It would really improve the quality of the resort if they would improve the food.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all dont believe all you read in these reviews! We had looked at these before we went and started to worry about things like the food, rooms etc but we were pleasantly suprised! The food layout at the buffet is amazing and the service is quick and friendly. The rooms are basic but comfortable and provide everything you will need for your stay, however we had problems with hot water in the first few days but was always sorted within 20 minutes.
reviews.title: Great time, beach is AMAZING!!!!

reviews.text: We stayed from May 3rd to 17th and it was very humid! Something for girls to take note on, GHD's dont work out there but my boyfriends little ones did!!
reviews.title: in depth, honest review.

reviews.text: The beach is AMAZING,white sands and clear blue sea with fish swimming right in front of you, good for snorkelling but watch out for the occasional big waves and strong undercurrent! Keep an eye out for 'photo time' on the beach...you'll know what we mean! :)
reviews.title: Fab time, loved it!!

reviews.text: If you stay for 2 weeks you get 6 ala carte restaurant bookings, we weren't that keen on the dominican (Conocu), but really enjoyed the Mexican (Sombrero), Japanese (Tokoyo...definitely take your camera to that) and the El Marlin.
reviews.title: Great Place

likes.liked: — The Staff & Mgrs worked so hard

reviews.text: I'm glad I have such a great time with my family no matter where I'm at, cause this place was one thing after another. When I checked in at 7pm, I notice that the cable was broken, the back door lock was broken (and I had a 1 year old child w/me), the toilet was broken (you had to put your arm in elbow deep into the tank to flush it every time you used it) and best of all the A/C was broken. I made the front desk aware of the problems that night and waited. I had called them to remind them that morning that no one had come yet and twenty-four hours later, the problem hadn't even been looked at. They finally had to switch my room only because I insisted. I think the front desk manager wanted to leave me there. The pool bar staff a.k.a. Manuela had the personality of a laxative. If she was polite or smiled once I think it would have been to much. Wasn't just with me, but everyone. I tried tipping her my first two times (tipping is not required) but soon realized that her crudeness didn't deserve a dime. The rest of the wait staff was pretty much a give and take, some good some bad.
reviews.title: Great time w/family, horrible time w/hotel & staff

reviews.text: The beach was gorgeous and the food was O.K. The is not one of those resorts that someone would say,"I want to return here". We will definitly be looking elsewhere in Punta Cana when we return next year.
reviews.title: No way 4* ! Stay somewhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After booking our holiday 9 months ago, 48hrs before we left we get a phone call saying our original hotel had over booked, l was told by resort rep this was quite common, beware! So 5pm on a Friday night we are left panicing trying to find another hotel or cancelling , which after waiting so long to go we really didnt want to do.We went with Barcelo Premium as at the time it had good reviews and rating, most hotels were full so we only had a choice of 3! Looking back now we should have cancelled.It cost an awful lot of money and in the end was a last minute holiday at full price but when you and your husband have booked time off work and your kids looking forward to it what can you do?
reviews.title: Hotel from Hell

likes.disliked: — the room and the service were terrible, terrible, terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first hotel looked ok. Lobby areas and restaurants fine. The rooms however, well ours at least, were unacceptable for a 4* hotel. l can only describe them as tired ,scruffy and worn out. Polyfiler used throughout bathroom to cover patches, broken tiles and infills. Shower head blocked so, after making a complaint, it was replaced, new one kept falling off. Hairdryer with no guard on so children could poke fingers in! On top of that it was dirty as well. The maid never cleaned the toilet, just put bleach or similar down it and wiped over sink taps.TOWELS! We spent every single day with some issue over them. Being all inclusive we thought we would have nothing to worry about instead every day was hassle.Only once in 14 days did we have 2 bath towels, 1 hand towel a flannel and bath mat. Be warned it wasn't just us. Our teenage children were in the room next door and had exactly the same problem as did other people on our floor, block 3 main building 4th floor. On two occasions for 2 whole days we had NO towels at all in ours or our kids room! When we did get towels even if we hadn't put them out for washing the maid would still take them! We complained to staff and rep many times, nothing seemed to help they just say ok or in 10 minutes. After a day at the beach what do you do! We tried tipping but after a couple of days we thought why should we tip for such appalling service. In fact we think the maid checked to see if we had left a tip and if we hadn't took she took the towels! Our beds were only changed once in two weeks and after 3 days maid knocked and gave us pillowcases! As you can imagine we will be writing to our tour operator with these unacceptable issues.Please dont choose this hotel there must be better. Location on beach superb and speciality restaurants top quality. Good Luck.
reviews.title: Descriptive review - lots of good, some so-so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we arrived at the barcelo punta cana and began to get excited because the hotel was very pristine on the exterior. however the nightmare began on check-in. we did not get a room key for five hours, even though we were told to return to the desk at 30 minute intervals. we tried to make the best of the situation by having lunch at the buffet restaurant, where we discovered that the food was not good quality, and by trying to get beach towels for the entire 5 hours. finally, we received our key. when we entered the room, which was in building 7 on the 3rd floor, we were greeted by this horrendous smell of mold and mustiness. i immediately called down to the front desk to advise them and was told that housekeeping would be there momentarily to address the problem. well needless to say that the smell remained the entire time of our stay, despite the constant air freshener smell that housekeeping tried to mask it with. also, the room was very shoddy and mold was evident under the bedroom mats and around the ceiling and tile grout. service was terrible. when you were able to find someone that spoke english, everything under the sun was promised, but nothing was ever delivered. not a working tv, not the correct amount of towels, not a cleaner, fresh smelling room, not daily beach towels, not fruit that was not covered with flies, and not poor quality food that was not laden with loads of salt. nothing was delivered. and even though i complained to 5 managers and got five excuses and promises to address my complaints, i received nothing. so, if you enjoy vacationing at a hotel from hell, then by all means barcelo punta cana is the place for you. by the way, we tried to change hotels, but after being told by our vacation rep, who had an office at the hotel, that the request had to be submitted, reviewed, and authorized over a period of four to five days, we had no choice but to stay.
reviews.title: 2nd trip to Punta Cana and we stayed here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was great!! Unfortunately we joined the VIP Club while we were there and got ripped off through our credit cards. We have been trying to get our money back for months to no avail.
reviews.title: Loved the resort but VIP Club is a rip off!!!

reviews.text: In conclusion, I recommend the resort wholeheartedly but do not get involved with the VIP Club!
reviews.title: NIghtmare
Great Looking Hotel--Bad Service
reviews.text: Disappointed in Carleton Place, Ontario

I thought this place needed an overhaul. Dirty, half of our 60 people group got sick, rooms were not acceptable and falling apart. Staff was ok. Shows were a joke. Drinks were horrible. I have stayed in better motel 6's.
reviews.title: Open up your mind

likes.liked: — The location on the beach and weather

reviews.title: A Dump
reviews.text: When it comes to travelling nothing makes me happier than good service. This hotel was lovely, the pool was excellent and the beach, well lets just say i hated to leave. BUT if you wanted a glass of water with your meal, a drink at the bar, a question at the reception desk answered you better give up before you bother, Every meal and i mean every meal, our family of five could not even get served. You would stop and ask someone to bring you water and at the end of the meal still no water. This went for the bar and reception as well. Our shower did not work properly when we arrived, let the front desk know and it still did not work properly when we left, i am not even sure if they came to look at it. I was very disapointed with the entertainment as well. The shows at night were very minimal. I will not go back. I understand the hotel just went through management changes but this is still no excuse.

Every summer my family and I travel to another country to relax and enjoy our vacations. We have been to the galapagos islands (which is the best place we have ever been), europe, australia and many others. This year we chose Punta Cana, Dominican Republic and let me tell you how BAD our experience was.
reviews.title: Do Yourself a Favor and Dont Book This Crap!

reviews.text: First of all the staff is TERRIBLE. They are not polite and hate their job. They hate americans and tourists.
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, we stayed in the Bavaro Palace which is supposed to be a 5-star hotel. For us, it was like a 2-stars hotel... it looks like a big Econolodge hotel.
reviews.title: *3-Star*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Third, the food if TERRIBLE too. Flies are everywhere and even the breakfast cereal tastes like its been out of the box for months.
reviews.title: 5 Star surroundings, 3.5 stars service and food

reviews.text: Fourth, the pool is dirty.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort and beach, questionable customer service

likes.liked: — really liked the suites, very spacious and nice
likes.disliked: — lack of assistance and common courtesy, especially when the locals took over on the weekends

reviews.title: Everything that could go WRONG did !!! PART 2
reviews.text: I already submitted a review, but after reading some more reviews I thought I should elaborate on my trip.

First of all, considering my friend and I arrived on our own, without a group of people, for example like when you arrive on a bus ( which i have done at all the other resorts I visited) our check-in took at least 45 minutes. This was a trip booked in April (our trip took place June 24 to July 1). Fancy drinks do not make up for their lack of organization and intentions to work. The room we actually booked for was given to someone else, so we were put somewhere else. I would say that they took advantage that we were to young girls ( 20 & 21 ) and could careless about our "accomodations". Our room was in building #1, and I think we were the only ones staying on that side of the resort. Why, you ask? Probably because there was no hot water, thats if there was water to begin with and because there was literally a "dump" on that side of the resort, and it smelled horrible!!! After countless number of phone calls to the front desk, we gave up. They simply don't care and have no intentions to work. They said they would put us in the room we were originally supposed to be in the next day, so we figured we could survive 1 night. Not suprisingly, when we went to switch rooms they told us that the people who were staying in that room decided to stay another week. Hmmmm, ok, but we told them we could not stay in that room another night and still wanted to switch. So they took us to a room that was "newly finished" and they were sure we would be completely satified. So there we were, in our new room. Little did we know, one night there was a tropical storm. Very close to being a hurricane. Chairs were flying, glasses were breaking, plantpots were breaking, pretty scary. And our room was flooded. There was water in the bathroom, in the living room (thank god we had one), and part of our bedroom. And when i say flooded, i mean it was like the little kids' pool at the resort. And might i add that we were on the 4th floor. Well, the next night came the blackout and it was just as eventful. I would say our entire stay had its ups and downs. Mostly downs.
reviews.title: Room for improvement, but overall enjoyable

reviews.text: Another major disappointment is the sexual harassment we experienced during our stay from the male staff. The sexual inneundos, and comments we received made us extremly uncomfortable. We eventually got to a point where we were just got sick of it and grew angry. They have no respect for women. So we began to treat them with the same respect they were showing us.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary:
reviews.title: Honey moon of our nightmares

likes.disliked: — Everything, the worst of all was the dirtiness

reviews.text: -staff is 100% lazy and have no intentions to work

reviews.text: We were a party of four from April 2-9-! It was a wonderful vacation....

reviews.text: Check-in: was more than perfect- Within 5 minutes I had the room requested by email. I had heard that building 6000 and 7000 was great and very quite..
reviews.title: Awesome beach, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: The TOKYO was very very good... Fun and the wine was GOOD! We also did the mexican twice: their fajitas were great: Both Turkey and beef was excellent!
reviews.title: Great Relaxing Vacation at a Great Price!!

likes.disliked: — Rooms musty and tipping out of control

reviews.text: Beach: I have been several places: Coxumel, Costa Maya, San Diego, Cancun and Puerto Plata and that beach was by far the most beautiful beach I ever seen on! White powder sand! Just wonderful!
reviews.title: Great time,loved it

likes.disliked: — the walking up to the 4th floor

reviews.text: Cabana: Or these thing that protects you from the sun: This is absolutely true- if you were not out by 730 it was very hard to get a spot......however tones of chair under the sun..
reviews.title: Great Spot for the Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from this resort. We had a wonderful time, we took the Island excursion, the speed boats & the atv's we had a blast on all of them but loved the ATV'S the most. The food was so so but i am a picky eater and always have a difficult time in other countries. It was Hotter than the dickens there this time of year. We checked out of the resort just in time as the locals piled in by the dozens. We were told they come in on Friday and leave on Sunday. It got way to crowded with them all and they were pretty rude to us and also to the employees there. The employees at the resort were so nice to us. We arrived there on a Friday but there were no locals that weekend just the weekend we were leaving. I like I said was sure glad to get out of there. Otherwise my stay at this resort was a great one.
reviews.title: Great Time!

likes.liked: — It was just beautiful the pool, beaches, room etc
likes.disliked: — the food cause I am a pickey eater no matter where I am

reviews.text: Seriously, if you want to have fun you can have it no matter where you go! If someone wants to complain they'll find something wrong no matter what!
reviews.title: A very honest review
The Truth about Barcelo Punta Cana
reviews.text: Let's start with the hotel.... okay, if you are expecting the Hilton you will be dissapointed.... you are going to a poor country. I will say that I felt so happy and at ease at this resort. It is beautiful ( a little worn in some areas but not what these others say it is ). Check in was fine.... we got there early and our room wasn't quite ready so they stored out bags and sent us on our way to the best beach I've ever seen.... I will say that the pics on the website for this resort do it justice... it's as nice if not nicer. Our room was comparable to staying at a holiday inn express, fine as far as I'm concerned for the amount of time you spend there. It was very clean and a couple bugs... an occasional one in the bathroom but I've seen more at my own house in the middle of summer. Our view was breathtaking, ocean view as well as the pool. I was very pleased.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we went snorkling(booked through the marina) they took us on a speed baot past over 15 other resorts and the only one that was nicer than ours was the Majestic and even their beach did not even compare!
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.liked: — The beach in Punta Cana is beautiful and it was no different here.

reviews.text: The restaurants and buffets were very good too... my fave being Tokyo. The food was all good with loads of variety and we all raved aboutthe BBQ chicken at the outdoor grill. My husband as well as the rest of the men we were with lived on the omelets for breakfast. I and the rest of the crew also loved the crab and the pasta. There really seemed to be something for absolutly anyone.
reviews.title: good times
The Morehead Reunion
reviews.text: Some of us did get sick one time or another (we went with 15 and I'd say less than half), nothing crazy, travellers sickness for an evening, or from drinking too many banana mamas(coconut milk is a natural diahretic LOL).
Barcelo Punta Cana Feb 3 - 10, 2007
reviews.title: One week wasn't enough

reviews.text: I have so much to tell, we just got back this morning 2/11. I just wanted to type this out right away to remember as much as I could. So, this might be long and jump around a bit.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did a lot of research and tried to book a fun resort for our group of 6 from MN, USA (ages 30 - 57). I have read many reviews before I booked and every review for months and months after and they really got me worried. I should have known better.
reviews.title: Absolutely Diabolical!!

reviews.text: This was our first trip to Punta Cana. This is also the first vacation that my husband has NOT gotten sick! We decided to take Acidophilus for the first time this trip. We started the week before we left and continued to take it while we were there (and will probably continue a few days after). I don't know if this is the reason he was completely "normal", but we'll take it again. One person out of the 6 of us did have diarrhea for about a day. All the fun people we met were having a great time as well and they didn't mention anything about being sick.
reviews.title: AMAZING........Wedding

reviews.text: Yes, this resort is being worked on, I saw people working hard every day. There are things that need fixing & painting and there are chipped and cracked tiles, along with things that need to be replaced like loose railings...ect. For us, no problem...we are easy going people who just wanted to have fun in the warm and sunny DR, we didn't let the small things detour us from having a great time. As long as the resort is clean with good service, no problemo.
reviews.title: Bad Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, we booked thru Cheap Caribbean. We -like others- never did this before & read the reviews...
reviews.title: Great Vacation!

reviews.text: The flight was smooth and we were in Punta Cana. The "Tiki Hut" style airport was different from ANYTHING we had seen, so it put us in the island mood. We were greeted by musicians and local women in native garb.
reviews.title: Maybe its gone downhill since the name change, but we liked it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our transport company was Turista. Friendly and fast, we were on the way to Barcelo in minutes.
reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews, we had a GREAT time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got to the hotel a little early, but the concierge "Mac", was very friendly, polite and we had no problems. In fact our room was being painted, so they gave us a better room with ocean/pool view in building 6, top floor.
reviews.title: Worst Vacation ever!
Excellent beyond our expectations
reviews.text: ROOM: clean, no odors, plumbing worked perfectly.

reviews.title: Employees need an attitude adjustment
reviews.text: We checked in on Saturday, September 22 with great difficulty. There is no system for line control and everyone just was huddled around the counter. This was our first negative experience. We had the unfortunate luck of checking in along with many locals who were staying for the weekend. We were at the counter when the clerk ignored us and checked in the locals ahead of us. We had an upgrade to an ocean view and were told the room would be ready in 20 minutes. We had a drink at the lobby bar and were given drinks with no ice. After repeated trips to the counter, we finally got our room two hours later.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When trying to get a drink or food, we felt invisible with all the locals getting served first. While waiting in line for shish-kabob, every local was served and when it came down to the last two shish-kabobs, I was standing there along with a local. The cook put both kabobs on the local's plate to my astonishment and left my plate empty. One of the grill cooks in the buffet burned my eggs on purpose and was grabbing his crotch while cooking them. Not every employee was this bad, but the few that were made the experience unpleasant.
reviews.title: Definitely Going Back

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of facility, and a great beach!
likes.disliked: — Food could have been a little better

reviews.text: The shows were terrible and never started on time. The entertainment people often gave wrong information about the events.
reviews.title: Really really ALL IN !!

likes.liked: — The fact the they gave us a much better room which changed the whole aspect of holidays. Great view on the beach and mountains!!
likes.disliked: — it's not new, which shows in details (things falling apart, paint coming off, the headboard of my bed fell off the wall, the bathroom ceiling :((, details...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort itself was not bad - the rooms were clean and the ocean and pool were wonderful.
reviews.title: Our honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok, the restaurants were adequate, nothing special.
reviews.title: Teppanyaki Cock roach racing mick &wendy norwich. U.K

reviews.text: This place is not as bad as some people have made it out to be. There were some negatives but many more positives. Check-in was quick although we did hit a snag when we got to our room and found that it wasn't what we had requested. Hence, our first meeting with Beronica at the front desk who was nothing less than wonderful. She stayed past her shift to find us a room that met our expectations. From day 1 she was incredible from making restaurant reservations, to getting things taken care of in the room, to helping us understand what we should pay for various items to giving us suggestions on what to do. If she was not working, Bernardo was there to help.
reviews.title: Had Alot Of Fun

reviews.text: The Tokio Restaurant was "the bomb" - the food was very good and our chef was quite the entertainer. Roma was pretty good as well; we skipped Paris and Canuco which we heard was not all that, ate at the buffet twice which was okay (best fresh sugar donuts in the a.m.) and at the Marlin which was only so-so the night we were there. The omelets at the grill by the pool were very good, the pizza and shish kabobs too.
reviews.title: Awesome, Gotta do it!

reviews.text: The bartenders were all friendly - Maribel and Rahdamene (sp) at the pool bar were the best. They always had a smile and treated us very well.
reviews.title: Horrible Dont Do It!

likes.disliked: — no one spoke english and the food

reviews.text: The pool was one of the best that I've seen and the beach was incredible. The sand was very powdery, the water a beautiful blue green and the waves were not that bad except on the last 2 days when the storms were approaching. Enough to ride the boogie boards but not so bad that they knocked you down.
reviews.title: Definetely worth the money

likes.disliked: — Couldn't get into the pool at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The disco was in the lowest level of the hotel and was pretty dark, not appealing at all. The casino was fairly small on the lower level with a couple of tables and quite a few slot machines; 2 people in our party did hit on the slots.
reviews.title: great honeymoon!!!! would gladly go back

reviews.text: I just got back from my 4 day vacation and the entire time I was there I was thinking "I can't wait to write about this on tripadvisor"

reviews.title: Great Place (especially for 4-12 yr old kids)

likes.liked: — beach, pool, and trapeze kid clinic

reviews.title: What a great place!!
reviews.text: As far as the resort, the rooms were extremely clean and the most of the staff was really helpful. Here is my advice for the rooms, the resort is built like a horshoe. I stayed in building 6 and this was the second best to building 7. We booked the cheapest room and we still had a balcony facing the pool and we could still see the ocean.. not really well but it was a great balcony to be on. We were in building 6. Originally we were booked in building 2. YUCK but at the front desk when I checked in I asked to see a map of the hotel and had them move me. So do it if you can!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food is not so good.. actually alot worse than I had imagined. They had the same things everyday and we managed to get into 2 restaurants, Tokyo and Marlin.. still not good at all! To me, food is really important because that's why all-inclusive sounds fun to me.. so if it is important to you, consider a better resort.
